title: Cluster-Based Multiple Comparisons
text: ClustMC implements cluster-based multiple comparisons tests. ClustMC implementa pruebas de comparaciones múltiples basadas en conglomerados.

title: Cluster-Based Multiple Comparisons
text: package can installed GitHub: / El paquete puede instalarse desde GitHub:

title: Cluster-Based Multiple Comparisons
text: following example applies Di Rienzo, Guzmán, Casanoves Test evaluate whether significant differences yields obtained control two different treatment conditions. El siguiente ejemplo aplica la Prueba de Di Rienzo, Guzmán y Casanoves para evaluar si existen diferencias significativas entre los rendimientos obtenidos bajo una condición de control y dos condiciones de tratamiento diferentes.
code: library(ClustMC)  data(PlantGrowth) plants_weights <- PlantGrowth$weight plants_trt <- PlantGrowth$group  anova_model <- aov(plants_weights ~ plants_trt)  dgc_test(y = anova_model, trt = "plants_trt") #>      group #> ctrl     1 #> trt1     1 #> trt2     2 #> Treatments within the same group are not significantly different

title: ClustMC: Cluster-Based Multiple Comparisons — ClustMC-package

what: Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons — dgc_test
title: Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons — dgc_test
text: Di Rienzo, Guzman Casanoves (DGC) test multiple comparisons. Implements cluster-based method identifying groups nonhomogeneous means.

title: Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons — dgc_test
code: dgc_test(   y,   trt,   alpha = 0.05,   show_plot = TRUE,   console = TRUE,   abline_options,   ... )

title: Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons — dgc_test
text: y Either model (created lm() aov()) numerical vector values response variable unit. trt y model, string name column containing treatments. y vector, vector length y treatments unit. alpha Value equivalent 0.05 0.01, corresponding significance level test. default value 0.05. show_plot Logical value indicating whether constructed dendrogram plotted . console Logical value indicating whether results printed console . abline_options list optional arguments line dendrogram. ... Optional arguments plot() function.

title: Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons — dgc_test
text: list three data.frame: stats data.frame containing summary statistics treatment. groups data.frame indicating group treatment assigned. parameters data.frame values used test. treatments total number treatments, alpha significance level used, c cut-criterion dendrogram (height horizontal line dendrogram), q 1-alpha quantile distribution Q (distance root node) null hypothesis SEM estimate standard error mean.

title: Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons — dgc_test
text: Di Rienzo, J.., Guzman, .W., Casanoves, F. (2002): multiple comparisons method based distribution root node distance binary tree. J. Agr.Biol. Environ. Stat. 7: 1-14.

title: Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons — dgc_test
Di Rienzo, Guzman and Casanoves test for multiple comparisons — dgc_test
code: data("PlantGrowth") # Using vectors ------------------------------------------------------- weights <- PlantGrowth$weight treatments <- PlantGrowth$group dgc_test(y = weights, trt = treatments, show_plot = FALSE) #>      group #> ctrl     1 #> trt1     1 #> trt2     2 #> Treatments within the same group are not significantly different # Using a model ------------------------------------------------------ model <- lm(weights ~ treatments) dgc_test(y = model, trt = "treatments", show_plot = FALSE) #>      group #> ctrl     1 #> trt1     1 #> trt2     2 #> Treatments within the same group are not significantly different
